poem:
Title: Distilled in Silver

In a theatre, where light falls in fragments,
An alien artefact unfolds the unknown.
Monolith - its echo shivers courage thin,
And paranoia looms, a disarray bone.
Rising hairs in Ligeti-esque whispers, akin
To 2001's Odyssey, sans Kubrick's tone.
A no-budget flicker, akin to life's whim, 
Yet bold, borrowing Villeneuve's clues, unknown.
In this cinema's spell, reality grows dim.
